strategy: Introduce a neural network architecture with multiple hidden layers and dropout regularization to model complex, non-linear interactions between features. Use a feedforward neural network with ReLU activation functions, initialized with He weighting, and train it using a custom loss function that penalizes under-prediction (e.g., weighted mean squared error with higher weights for low-price homes). Apply feature scaling via min-max normalization to stabilize training and enable gradient descent convergence. Perform hyperparameter tuning on learning rate, number of layers, and batch size using Bayesian optimization, while evaluating R2 on time-series split cross-validation to ensure temporal stability. This approach leverages deep learning’s capacity to learn hierarchical patterns beyond tree-based models.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import MinMaxScaler
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.keras.models import Sequential
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense, Dropout
from tensorflow.keras.optimizers import Adam
from tensorflow.keras.callbacks import EarlyStopping
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set random seeds for reproducibility
np.random.seed(42)
tf.random.set_seed(42)

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values
X[numerical_columns] = X[numerical_columns].fillna(X[numerical_columns].median())
X[categorical_columns] = X[categorical_columns].fillna(X[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
encoder = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first', sparse_output=False)
X_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X[categorical_columns])
X_encoded_df = pd.DataFrame(X_encoded, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))

# Combine with numerical features
X_final = pd.concat([X[numerical_columns], X_encoded_df], axis=1)

# Normalize numerical features using min-max scaling
scaler = MinMaxScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_final)
X_scaled = pd.DataFrame(X_scaled, columns=X_final.columns)

# Prepare test data
test_X = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test_X[numerical_columns] = test_X[numerical_columns].fillna(test_X[numerical_columns].median())
test_X[categorical_columns] = test_X[categorical_columns].fillna(test_X[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, MinMaxScaler
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set random seeds for reproducibility
np.random.seed(42)

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values
X[numerical_columns] = X[numerical_columns].fillna(X[numerical_columns].median())
X[categorical_columns] = X[categorical_columns].fillna(X[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
encoder = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first', sparse_output=False)
X_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X[categorical_columns])
X_encoded_df = pd.DataFrame(X_encoded, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))

# Combine with numerical features
X_final = pd.concat([X[numerical_columns], X_encoded_df], axis=1)

# Normalize numerical features using min-max scaling
scaler = MinMaxScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_final)
X_scaled = pd.DataFrame(X_scaled, columns=X_final.columns)
